channel.title: Save the forum
channel.description:
I'm afraid that every thread in the forum is starting to look like this:
[i]<a topic> <2 replies on topic> <someone asking for a release date> <flame war>[/i]
Now I don't want to bitch and I'm a patient guy, but can't the devs look for a PR guy or something. Because really, what's stated on the homepage of the website:
[i]Updates via twitter follow us for [b][COLOR='Red']recent[/b] updates. old school like the old school. [url]https://bit.ly/cnTITi[/url] [b][COLOR='Red']215 days ago[/b][/i]
That's just a bit ridiculous don't you think. I really don't care about a date, but save the forum pls.

item.title: Save the forum
item.dc:creator: Madcat1030
item.description:
first-time IP addresses to forums.blackmesasource.com/* should be sent straight to the FAQ, a 3 minute timer should come up at the top of the page, and when that runs out, and the scroll bar is all the way down, it will allow them to continue, to the “isblackmesareleased.com”, and after that is done posting it’s MANY useful links, they should be allowed onto the forums. If they don’t go through all of both sites, they keep getting brought back to the FAQ with 3-minute timer.

And I totally missed Raminator’s update: I’m glad to hear you guys are happy with progress. Hope to see it by the end of winter. Just don’t release it over generalized winter break-type dates. Lol, I won’t have my computer…

Read full topic

item.title: Save the forum
item.dc:creator: MysticJ
item.description:
Raminator:

Progress has been steady recently, and although we’re not quite hitting our self-imposed milestones as closely as we’d wanted to, we’re still pretty pleased with the way things are turning out. I’m sure the mod isn’t going to live up to a lot of people’s overhyped expectations given the length of time, but everyone on the team can still play it and have fun, even after all these years. That’s got to be worth something.

Thank you.

Would be cool if this could be posted to the “Updates about the status of the mod” thread.

Read full topic

item.title: Save the forum
item.dc:creator: russilker
item.description:
if this mod does not look like crysis HL style i will ragepost all over these forums

…unlike many people i here, im active on the forums just because i enjoy them. the mod will just be a very pleasant thing when it comes out, but its not like im on here solely for that purpose. hell, i think ill find more fun admiring each and every detail of the mod because i know ill be comparing it to a retail game and going “oh wow, we need more passionate game makers out there”

tl;dr: i will have a nervous breakdown when the mod comes out

Read full topic

Well, the same thing happens to me with everything I do, from trying to make friends, to working, to chat up a girl or even to post on this forum… hell, you guys must be sick of me posting on this forum… I will just return to my dark corner.

item.title: Save the forum
item.dc:creator: Katana
item.description:
Havelok:

Dev teams are always disillusioned about the quality of their own work.

Talk to any developer at a game company. They will always say “I just hope the fans like it” in a half worried voice when asked about the quality of their game. Even for undeniably awesome games such as God of War III, this was the case.

If Ram says that members of the team have played it and had fun, that is a very, very good sign.

Thier ability to enjoy the game is MUCH less then ours, being “new” players, because they know every little detail about pretty much everything and know how this works and that works and have been exposed to everything the game has had to offer for nearly half a decade. That does make an impact on ones enjoyment of the game.

Its the artists sacrifice: You will never enjoy your work as much as someone from your audience might.

So guys. The game will come out. And it will be awesome. End of story.

Pretty much true. On my last playtesting of something:
DAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA GOD HIS MOUTH DIDN’T QUITE LOOK LIKE A SMILE AFTER THAT SNARKY COMMENT, GOD EVERYONE’S GONNA HATE IT

Read full topic

item.title: Save the forum
item.dc:creator: Havelok
item.description:
Dev teams are always disillusioned about the quality of their own work.

Talk to any developer at a game company. They will always say “I just hope the fans like it” in a half worried voice when asked about the quality of their game. Even for undeniably awesome games such as God of War III, this was the case.

If Ram says that members of the team have played it and had fun, that is a very, very good sign.

Thier ability to enjoy the game is MUCH less then ours, being “new” players, because they know every little detail about pretty much everything and know how this works and that works and have been exposed to everything the game has had to offer for nearly half a decade. That does make an impact on ones enjoyment of the game.

Its the artists sacrifice: You will never enjoy your work as much as someone from your audience might.

So guys. The game will come out. And it will be awesome. End of story.

Read full topic

item.title: Save the forum
item.dc:creator: X-tra
item.description:
SkyBlue:

However, I’m sure the mod will live up to my expectations (considering I’ve been following BM since at least 2007 and its BMS days) of just playing through Half-Life but with far more life-like environments, if the screenshots are anything to go by. And more importantly, if it’s fun, then your job is done!

Sorry to burst your bubble but I find you a bit too optimistic.

Read full topic

item.title: Save the forum
item.dc:creator: SkyBlue
item.description:
Raminator:

Progress has been steady recently, and although we’re not quite hitting our self-imposed milestones as closely as we’d wanted to, we’re still pretty pleased with the way things are turning out. I’m sure the mod isn’t going to live up to a lot of people’s overhyped expectations given the length of time, but everyone on the team can still play it and have fun, even after all these years. That’s got to be worth something.

Thank you very much! This is exactly the sort of thing I’d been hoping for. Just as a suggestion, maybe this could go in a separate sticky thread, or be put in the FAQ, or on the main page, even if it’s only just for the sake of other lurkers?

However, I’m sure the mod will live up to my expectations (considering I’ve been following BM since at least 2007 and its BMS days) of just playing through Half-Life but with far more life-like environments, if the screenshots are anything to go by. And more importantly, if it’s fun, then your job is done!

Read full topic

item.title: Save the forum
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
JeffMOD:

A couple of months ago, Ram said that due to the amount of work they were getting done, regardless of whether they meet their internal deadline or not, it’ll be done by the end of 12 months if they keep working at that level of efficiency. (And as that was a couple of months ago, do the math) And that also means the internal deadline is less than 12 months, so don’t worry about release dates.

I wouldn’t hold on to that. Just wait for it like a man.

Read full topic

item.title: Save the forum
item.dc:creator: little_scrapper
item.description:
I have been saying for over three years that this whole idea/mod is a hoax and is not even real, and have been asking the devs to produce some video of someone actually playing the mod. Proof of life if you will. Thier responce was to link to lame arse box levels that show nothing more than a alternate skinned health station or door. Phht.

Show me some video of someone actually PLAYING BM! The only thing that I have seen is a “so-called” demo video. A demo video doesnt prove a mod exists. A video shot over someones shoulder showing a real person playing the mod gives credibility.

Until I see proof that the devs have done anything after 2005 besides making skins for counter strike, I am laying down the BLLSHT card on the devs.

Mod doesnt exist beyond a bunch of pictures and video that was probably created as a portfolio piece.

Prove me wrong!

Read full topic
